FacilityStr1: 1 Mile West of 83 Highway at Road 6

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
OUR COMPANY IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT SPECIALIZES IN SELLING AGRICULTURAL INPUTS FOR AREA PRODUCERS. THIS COMPANY STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A SAFE AND HEALTHY WORK PLACE. OUR OWNERS, MANAGERS, AND EMPLOYEES HAVE MADE EVERY EFFORT TO PLAN THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASEOF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. 



OUR PLANT CONSISTS OF (1)30,000 GALLON ANHYDROUS AMMONIA TANK AND WHEN FILLED TO 85% CAPACITY WILL HOLD APPROXIMATELY 132,000 POUNDS AND (14)1,000 GALLON ANHYDROUS AMMONIA NURSE TANKS WITH THE CAPACITY OF 44,000 POUNDS, THIS MAKES THE COMPANY'S TOTAL CAPACITY 192,610 POUNDS.



THE WORST CASE AND THE ALTERNATE RELEASE SCENARIOS HAVE BEEN EVALUATED AND SHARED WITH OUR LOCAL FIRST RESPONDERS AS PART OF AN-ONGOING TRAINING PROGRAM. MORE IMPORTANTLY OUR EMPLOYEES HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE EMERGENCY ACTIONS, INCLUDING THE EMERGENCY MEETING PLACE AND EACH OF THEIR INDIVIDUAL RESPONSIBILITIES REGARDING AN ACCIDENT RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. 



THIS COMPANY MAINTAINS AND OPERATES THEIR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT IN STRICT ACCORDANCE WITH ALL STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES. THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR PLANT OR A REGULAR BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH THEIR REQUESTS FOR IMPROVEMENT. CHANGES OR IMPROVEMENTS IN THE FACILITIES EQUIPMENT WILL BE ACTED UPON IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING THE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY (KDA'S) REQUEST, OR AS FOUND TO BE NECESSARY BY OUR MAINTENANCE STAFF.



OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN SAFETY PROCEDURES, SITE SPECIFIC OPERATING PROCEDURES,PLANT MAINTEANCE, AND THE EMPLOYEES ARE COMPETENCY TESTED OVER THE TRAINING MATERIAL. EACH EMPLOYEE USES GOGGLES AND GLOVES DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS AS WELL AS ALWAYS PROVIDING PLENTY OF EMERGENCY SAFETY WARER DURING THE NURSE TANK LOADING OPERATIONS. 



WITH THE ABOVE-MENTIONED TRAINING IN MIND, IT MAKES IT VERY EASY TO REPORT THAT ABSOLUTELY NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR PROPERTY DAMAGE HAS OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS. 



OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE RIS

K TO EMPLOYEES, THE SURROUNDING PUBLIC AND THE AREA OF FIRST RESPONDERS. THIS COMPANY PROVIDES PLANT TOURS FOR LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND OUR ACTION PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE COUNTY LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMISSION (LEPC.) EACH OF OUR RESPONDING AGENCIES AREA AWARE OF THE DANGEROUS NATURE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND THEY HAVE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY OR ACCIDENTAL RELEASE.
